results.title: Point break (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Kathryn Bigelow, Robert L Levy, Peter Abrams and Largo Entertainment
results.brief_description: Kathryn Bigelow’s (Strange Days, Blue Steel) fourth feature is a study of masculinity and surfer culture. Johnny Utah (Keanu Reeves) is a rookie FBI agent working undercover trying to crack an elite group of bank robbers who wear masks of ex-Presidents to hide their identities. As the criminals are thought to belong to an exclusive surfer cult, Utah learns to surf to infiltrate the group. Utah selects Tyler (Lori Petty), who is unaware of his true identity, to teach him the breaks that will make him a convincing surfer and keep his cover sound. Utah meets Bodhi (Patrick Swayze) a top surfer and adrenalin junkie, for whom surfing has a spiritual and mythical significance. “Point Break” is an action film that contains some impressive stunts including car chases, leaps from aeroplanes, exploding petrol stations and memorable scenes of breaking waves. Reeves is interestingly cast as the straight-laced policeman who has to learn the speech and mannerisms of a stoner dude. Filmed in Hawaii, California, Oregon and Bondi Beach, New South Wales.

results.title: Plenty
results.creator_credit: Fred Schepisi, Edward Pressman, RKO Radio Pictures and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the play of the same name by David Hare. A young Englishwoman returns from fighting with the resistance in World War 2 and finds the apathy of post-war England difficult to tolerate. As her idealistic dreams give way to the realities of experience so her sanity gives way to madness. Stars Meryl Streep, Charles Dance, Tracey Ullman, John Gielgud, Sting and Sam Neill.

results.title: Pleasantville
results.creator_credit: Gary Ross, Steven Soderbergh, Robert J. Degus, Jon Kilik and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Dejected teenager David (Tobey Maguire) suffers all the complexities of 90s adolescence. Confronted by doomsaying school teachers and dwindling job prospects, David seeks refuge in his favourite TV show - an old-fashioned, black and white sitcom called Pleasantville. One fateful night a mysterious TV repairman transports David and his precocious sister Jennifer (Reese Witherspoon) inside the fantastic world of Pleasantville, where life is a curious routine of niceties and home-spun values. But the pair’s arrival turns everyday life on its head for the small town, until now untouched by concepts of sex, rebellion, and most notably, colour. An insightful satire of the American Dream, Pleasantville combines pioneering photographic techniques with a stellar cast including Joan Allen, J.T. Walsh, William H. Macy, Jeff Daniels and comic legend Don Knotts as the elusive TV repairman.

results.title: Playful Pluto
results.creator_credit: Joseph Schenck and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Animated cartoon starring Mickey Mouse and Pluto. Begins with Mickey raking up leaves in his garden and playful Pluto trying his best to be helpful but instead creating total mayhem, going from one catastrophe to another.

results.title: Platoon
results.creator_credit: Oliver Stone, Arnold Kopelson and Hemdale Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Oliver Stone’s breakthrough as a director, and based on his first-hand experience, “Platoon” is a brutally realistic look at a young soldier’s tour of duty in Vietnam. Chris Taylor is a college student who quits school to volunteer for the Army. After a few weeks at war however, he begins to see the naivete of his views of the war. He quickly discovers that he must do battle with not only the Viet Cong, but also the gnawing fear, physical exhaustion and the intense anger growing within him. Cast includes: Charlie Sheen, Willem Dafoe, Tom Berenger, Forest Whitaker and John McGinley.

results.title: Plasmo
results.creator_credit: Plasmo Mega Studios, Film Victoria, Beyond International, Tony Wright and Anthony Lawrence
results.brief_description: Plasmo, Parsty and Nik Nik are stuck on the planet Pynco, desperate to return home, when they come across two explorers, Brucho and Coredor. This tape includes seven adventures previously screened on ABC television. Episodes include: PLASMO AND THE MOONTOWER, PLASMO BLASTS OFF, PLASMO IN DEEP SPACE, PLASMO ARRIVES, TOUR OF MONJOTROLDECLIPDOC, PLASMO AND THE SPACE GHOSTS, PLASMO AND THE BOOKWORM. The magic of puppetry and animation used to create Plasmo’s world will delight children everywhere. Voices provided by Abbe Holmes, Pia Morley and Phil Houghton.

results.title: Planet of the apes
results.creator_credit: Franklin J. Schaffner, Arthur P. Jacobs, Mort Abrahams, APJAC Productions and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Charlton Heston and two other astronauts come out of deep hibernation to find that their ship has crashed. Escaping with little more than clothes, they find that they have landed on a planet where men are pre-lingual and uncivilized, while apes have learned speech and technology and use the primitive humans for experimentation and sport. Taylor (Heston) is captured and taken to the city of the apes after damaging his throat so that he is silent and cannot communicate with them. But with the help of a benevolent chimpanzee scientist (Roddy McDowall), Taylor escapes their leathery clutches only to be confronted by a chilling fate. Interesting Note: During breaks in filming, actors made up as different ape species tended to hang out together—-apes with apes, orangutans with orangutans, chimps with chimps. It wasn’t required, it just naturally happened. Includes 25 minutes “Making Of” program.

results.title: Pink Floyd - The Wall
results.creator_credit: Gerald Scarfe, Allan Parker, Alan Marshall, Goldcrest and Tin Blue
results.brief_description: Pink Floyd’s landmark album was translated into an original rock music motion picture experience. Bob Geldof plays Pink, a burnt out rock superstar who thinks he is going mad inside a room at a Los Angeles hotel. The film takes us on a downward spiral into Pink’s hell. Live action is intercut with brilliant animation by Gerald Scarfe and the soundtrack by Pink Floyd has given this film its cult status.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gerald Scarfe, Allan Parker, Alan Marshall, Goldcrest and Tin Blue

results.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Peter Weir, Patricia Lovell, Jim McElroy, Hal McElroy and McElroy & McElroy
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1900 three girls from a private school and their teacher unaccountably vanish on a St Valentine’s Day school picnic to a mysterious rock in the midst of the Australian bush. The Victorian girls’ school for the daughters of the privileged gradually becomes contaminated and destroyed from within by its inability to understand the forces confronting it. Based on a novel which mythologises the emergence of sexuality, the film atmospherically follows various tangents without distilling a sense of explanation. Unease is evoked by the horror of not knowing. Based on the novel by Joan Lindsay. Cast includes Rachel Roberts, Dominic Guard, Helen Morse and Jacki Weaver.

results.title: Performance
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Donald Cammell, Sanford Lieberson, Goodtime Enterprises and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: James Fox is Chas, a working-class London hitman, who is violent, cunning and ruthless. His growing arrogance results in a murder which sets his gangster boss against him. On the run, and fearing for his life, Chas holes up in the basement apartment of an ex-rock star (Mick Jagger) who lives with his two bisexual girlfriends (Anita Pallenberg & Michele Breton). The two men experience an initial repulsion then increasing fascination with each other, and under the influence of hallucinogenic drugs, they begin slowly to merge personas. This startling, original film uses the techniques and experiments of underground cinema to investigate the dislocation suffered by both bourgeois and working-class sexualities when confronted by the permissiveness of the hippie subculture. Fox, hard and masculine, and Jagger, soft and androgynous, both give two superb homoerotic performances. The electric rock score includes original music by Mick Jagger, The Last Poets and Ry Cooder.
